intro: Limonium ocymifolium subsp. bellidifolium, commonly known as the pink sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit and produces showy, clustered pink or purple flowers. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in sandy or coastal environments. It is a member of the Plumbagaceae family and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
